intro: Geniostoma dallmannense, commonly known as the Dallmann's geniostoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
